alert.note: Alert for La Plata; Montezuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 01 at 1:49PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...HEAVY RUNOFF FROM SNOWMELT WILL LEAD TO HIGH FLOWS AND INCREASING RIVER LEVELS ACROSS MANY TRIBUTARIES AND THE MAIN STEM OF THE MANCOS RIVER THROUGH THE WEEK... Snowmelt from above normal/record seasonal snowpack combined with warm, spring temperatures have increased flow rates well above normal for this time of year along the Mancos River. Temperatures of 10 to 15 degrees above normal today will gradually cool through the week. However accelerated snowmelt will continue through the week. County roadways and low lying areas along the Mancos River within Montezuma County may become inundated with water, making river crosses difficult or impossible. Please heed all road closures and find an alternate route.
